anomalies: MICR mismatch: Check number on top (1001) doesn't match bottom MICR line (1007) - instant fraud flag
Bank logo may be incorrect - Chase logo should have official blue octagon design
Missing security features: No microprinting, padlock icon, or security background - real checks have built-in protection

feature_importance: Serial number doesn't match issuer pattern
Serial number doesn't match issuer pattern

ai_analysis.summary: The money order is missing all critical fields, fails issuer and serial validations, and carries a 100% ML fraud risk score with 97.2% confidence—strong indicators of counterfeit or invalid documentation.
ai_analysis.reasoning:
- ML Model Scores: Fraud risk 100.0%, RF 98.3%, XGBoost 99.7%, overall confidence 97.2% (well above the 85% reject threshold).  
- Missing Critical Fields: No issuer, serial number, written amount, payee, purchaser or location—matches “Missing Fields” fraud pattern in 12.8% of training fraud cases.  
- Invalid Issuer/Serial: “CHASE BANK” not recognized; serial pattern fails issuer-specific validation; aligns with “Invalid Serial” pattern (12.4%).  
- Amount Parsing Low Confidence: No written amount to cross-verify numeric value; ties to “Amount Mismatch” (12.8%) and “Altered Amount” (12.4%) patterns.  
- Date Inconsistency: Dated 2025-10-26—future-dated orders are a known red flag (12.4%).  
- No Customer History: Unable to corroborate purchaser credibility or past behavior.  
- Similar Past Cases: Three prior analyses with identical missing-data profile yielded 100% risk and ended in REJECT or ERROR.
key_indicators: Missing issuer, serial, payee, purchaser fields
Invalid issuer name and serial format
ai_analysis.verification_notes:
(If manually reviewed before final disposition)  
- Confirm issuer legitimacy and branch details directly with CHASE BANK operations  
- Validate any underlying receipt or purchaser ID to rule out data-entry error
ai_analysis.training_insights:
- “Missing Fields” and “Invalid Serial” appear in ~12.8% and ~12.4% of fraudulent orders respectively, reinforcing this case’s high-risk status.  
- Future-dated instruments constitute ~12.4% of fraud patterns, supporting rejection.
ai_analysis.historical_comparison: All three past money orders of $125.75 with missing fields and invalid issuer/serial patterns were recommended for REJECT (or resulted in ERROR), mirroring the current case’s profile.
